skills.title: User Interface (UI) Design
skills.description: Expertise in creating user interfaces that are visually appealing, consistent, and in line with brand identity. This includes the use of design principles such as typography, color, iconography, and layout to ensure the interface looks professional and is easy to use.

skills.title: User Experience (UX) Design
skills.description: Ability to design intuitive and efficient user experiences. Involves processes such as user research, wireframing, prototyping, and testing to understand user needs and ensure the product meets their expectations in a simple and effective manner.

skills.title: Front-End Development
skills.description: Technical skills to turn UI/UX designs into working code. Using technologies like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and frameworks like React or Vue.js to build applications that are responsive, interactive, and compatible across devices, browsers, and screen sizes for optimal performance.

skills.title: Responsive & Accessible Design
skills.description: Ensuring products are accessible across devices (desktop, tablet, smartphone) and meet web accessibility standards (WCAG). This includes using media queries, grid systems, and semantic HTML to create inclusive sites for all users, including those with disabilities.
